Definition.WordDefinition: let down v 1: move something or somebody to a lower position; "take down the vase from the shelf" [syn: {lower}, {take down}, {get down}, {bring down}] [ant: {raise}] 2: fail to meet the hopes or expectations of; "Her boyfriend let her down when he did not propose marriage" [syn: {disappoint}]
letdown n : a feeling of dissatisfaction that results when your expectations are not realized; "his hopes were so high he was doomed to disappointment" [syn: {disappointment}]
